DataElement.preferredName: Prior Agent Intervention And Therapy-Related Toxicity Inclusion Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response as to whether a patient meets the inclusion criteria addressing prior agents that produce an effect, or alter the course of a disease in a patient and their associated  toxicities.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prior Agent Intervention And Therapy-Related Toxicity Inclusion Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order._An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect._An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects associated with the action or administration of therapeutic agents._Medical and/or social characteristics which are necessary for a subject to be allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. Meeting inclusion criteria is not a sufficient condition for entry or recruitment of a subject into the study. Characteristics limiting the eligibility of a subject for the clinical study must be considered.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.

Property.preferredName: Intervention or Procedure And Therapy-Related Toxicity Inclusion Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects associated with the action or administration of therapeutic agents.:Medical and/or social characteristics which are necessary for a subject to be allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. Meeting inclusion criteria is not a sufficient condition for entry or recruitment of a subject into the study. Characteristics limiting the eligibility of a subject for the clinical study must be considered.

Concepts.definition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects associated with the action or administration of therapeutic agents.

Medical and/or social characteristics which are necessary for a subject to be allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. Meeting inclusion criteria is not a sufficient condition for entry or recruitment of a subject into the study. Characteristics limiting the eligibility of a subject for the clinical study must be considered.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Have a minimum of 21 days ela
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have a minimum of 21 days elapsed from the last dose of any agent and the resolution of associated toxicities?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have a minimum of 21 days elapsed from the last dose and resolution of toxicity excluding less than or equal to grade 2 peripheral neuropathy or alopecia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have a minimum of 21 days elapsed from the last dose of chemotherapy and resolution of toxicity excluding less than or equal to grade 2 peripheral neuropathy or alopecia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have at least 28 days elapsed since last therapy and toxicities related to the last therapy have resolved?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have at least 21 days elapsed from prior therapy (chemotherapy or radiation)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have a minimum of 21 days elapsed from the last dose of chemotherapy and resolution of toxicity to less than or equal to grade 1 excluding less than or equal to grade 2 peripheral neuropathy or alopecia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: For relapse/refractory patients: Have at least 14 days or 5 half-lives elapsed (whichever is shorter) since last therapy dose and toxicities related to the last therapy have resolved?
